conversation.content: [frustrated] I can't believe this. I literally can't believe this is happening. Marcus ate those damaged cookies from the bakery—I watched him do it! He stood right there by the dumpster, stuffing his face, telling me it was fine because they were getting thrown out anyway. [angry] And now I'M fired? For theft? [pause] He looked me straight in the eye during that meeting, sitting there next to the district manager, and he just... he let them think it was me. [bitter] Three years. Three years I've been bagging groceries, never late, always covering shifts, and this is what I get? [quietly] The security footage probably shows him clear as day but, um, but I guess nobody's gonna check that, right? [sarcastic] Why would they? It's just easier to fire the part-timer. [upset] My mom's gonna kill me. I needed this job for college. I needed— [trailing off] [pause] [very sad] You know what the worst part is? I actually liked Marcus. Thought he was cool. He'd joke around during slow shifts, buy us energy drinks sometimes. [laugh] God, I'm such an idiot. [exhausted] Twenty-three dollars in damaged cookies. That's what my job was worth to him. Twenty-three dollars.

subject: Getting fired from your grocery bagging job for something your supervisor actually did
